aboutContent1: I aim to create websites that are easy to understand and accessible to everyone. I believe the web is more than just a screen—it can make someone’s day more convenient and enjoyable.
aboutContent2: My interest in development began during my high school study abroad, when I discovered an interactive website made with HTML5 and JavaScript on YouTube. At the time, I didn’t even know what 'JavaScript' was, but I was inspired to create something similar.
aboutContent3: From now on, I want to design experiences that connect people and technology closely, guided by user-centered thinking and careful attention.
timelineTitle: I believe every challenge is a chance to learn and every experience adds a new layer to who I am.

timelineItems.title: First Design Contest
timelineItems.description: My very first competition — I had no idea what I was doing. I just wanted to get into my dream school, and I did! A small win that taught me the power of trying.

timelineItems.title: Studying Abroad in the U.S.
timelineItems.description: Lived a year in the U.S. Learned to communicate, adapt, and stay strong. Solved a tough home stay issue on my own and came back with real confidence.

timelineItems.title: My First Job: Ice Cream Shop
timelineItems.description: Turned challenges into smiles. Suggested better workflows, supported teammates, and made customers happier. Ended up promoted to manager — my first taste of leadership.

timelineItems.title: SCA Barista Certification
timelineItems.description: Balanced work and study to earn an international barista license. Learned patience, precision, and how a single cup can brighten someone’s day.

timelineItems.title: AI Summer Camp & CO-WEEK
timelineItems.description: Built my first AI project using MODI blocks. Spent a week living and coding with my teammates — that teamwork experience still shapes how I work today.

timelineItems.title: CO-WEEK Academy in KMU
timelineItems.description: Joined a one-week AI and tech program at Keimyung University. Met students and professors from all over the country — an inspiring week of learning and connection.

timelineItems.title: Study Abroad in Germany: THU Ulm
timelineItems.description: A month in Germany, studying and collaborating across cultures. Visited industries, joined a global project, and our team was named ‘Most Creative Team’. Gained a new sense of curiosity and courage.

timelineItems.title: Nepal Student Orientation Volunteer
timelineItems.description: Helped new students from Nepal settle into dorm life. Translated guides, gave tours, and learned how meaningful it is to make someone feel welcomed.

timelineItems.title: AI Hackathon - AIM Challenge
timelineItems.description: Led a team in an AI hackathon. Didn’t win, but learned more about teamwork, growth, and staying driven than any trophy could teach me.

timelineItems.title: Shinhan Hey Young Supporters
timelineItems.description: Planned and ran creative marketing projects as part of Shinhan Bank’s Hey Young Supporters. Organized a campus booth and saw how ideas turn into impact.

timelineItems.title: Buddy Program & YJU Foreign Language Presentation Contest
timelineItems.description: Worked with international students on a UCC project that won an excellence award. Shared ideas, learned cultures, and found that communication goes far beyond language.

timelineItems.title: Osaka IT Training
timelineItems.description: Spent a month in Osaka for an IT training program. Improved my Japanese and made my dream of becoming a developer in Japan feel closer than ever.
